title: MethylSurroGetR
text: can use devtools package install development version MethylSurroGetR GitHub. package installed, can load package.

title: MethylSurroGetR
text: minimum, MethylSurroGetR requires two input objects: methylation matrix named vector, matrix, data frame surrogate weights.

title: MethylSurroGetR
text: ’ll start loading matrix beta values. Notice probe IDs row names sample IDs column names. required orientation MethylSurroGetR.

title: MethylSurroGetR
text: Next, ’ll load named vector weights construct surrogate.

title: MethylSurroGetR
text: order generate predicted values surrogate weights, need construct mehtyl_surro object. , use surro_set() function specify methylation matrix methyl weights object weights option. addition, need specify character string name intercept weights object (applicable) intercept option. can see resulting methyl_surro object three elements correspond inputs: methyl, weights, intercept. addition placing inputs object element, function also subset methylation matrix include probes included weights (nothing ). Although makes little difference toy example, methylation matrices real world contain hundeds thousands probes, many surrogates constructed using tens thousands probes.

title: MethylSurroGetR
text: Notice number missing values methyl element my_surrogate. next step address .

title: MethylSurroGetR
text: MethylSurroGetR distinguishes two types missing values: Notice cg01 missing methylation matrix samp2, samp3, samp5. Similarly, cg07 missing samp5. Notice cg03, cg06, cg11, cg15, cg18 included among surrogate weights, methylation data.

title: MethylSurroGetR
text: Next, can check new methylation matrix missing values. seems silly small example, can much helpful working real data. Notice object created methyl_miss() contains element type missing data: missing observations (missing_obs), function returns named vector proportion samples missing probes. missing probes (missing_probes), function returns character vector probes missing samples.
code: missing <- methyl_miss(methyl_surro = my_surrogate) print(missing) #> $missing_obs #> cg02 cg07  #>  0.6  0.2  #>  #> $missing_probes #> [1] "cg03" "cg06" "cg11" "cg15" "cg18"

title: MethylSurroGetR
text: Now know missing values, ’ll begin addressing imputing missing observations impute_obs(). Required inputs function methyl_surro object, character string denote method (currently available options “mean” “median”). optional min_nonmiss_prop option can specified impute observations probes specified proportion non-missing values.

what: Filling Missing Probes from Reference Data
title: MethylSurroGetR
text: Now ’ve imputed missing observations, need account missing probes (.e., missing samples). , ’ll need draw reference panel (ref_vec_mean) fill values reference_fill() function. ’ll need specify methyl_surro object, reference object (requires named vector, matrix, data frame), type values fill. Since ’ve already accounted missing observations, ’ll use type = "probes" fill missing probes. Alternatively, function can used fill missing observations (type = "obs"), missing observations probes simultaneously (type = "").

title: MethylSurroGetR
text: ’re finally ready generate predicted values! , ’ll use surro_calc() function. need specify methyl_surro object, well transform method. case, surrogate weights created using elastic net regression model Gaussian link function, ’ll use transform = "linear". surrogate weights developed using logit link function, predicted probabilities can estimated transform = "probability". developed using Poisson link function, predicted counts can generated transform = "count".
code: estimates <- surro_calc(methyl_surro = my_surrogate,                         transform = "linear") print(estimates) #>    samp1    samp2    samp3    samp4    samp5  #> 1.197718 1.202317 1.201093 1.199796 1.201382

title: MethylSurroGetR
text: simplify process estimating predicted surrogate values, can pipe commands single string clean code.
code: estimates <- beta_matrix_miss |>   surro_set(weights = wts_vec_lin, intercept = "Intercept") |>   impute_obs(method = "mean") |>   reference_fill(reference = ref_vec_mean, type = "probes") |>   surro_calc(transform = "linear") print(estimates) #>    samp1    samp2    samp3    samp4    samp5  #> 1.197718 1.202317 1.201093 1.199796 1.201382

title: Authors and Citation
text: Joshua . Goode. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Goode J (2025). MethylSurroGetR: Get Predicted Values DNA Methylation Surrogates. R package version 0.0.0.9000, https://github.com/jagoode27/MethylSurroGetR.
code: @Manual{,   title = {MethylSurroGetR: Get Predicted Values of DNA Methylation Surrogates},   author = {Joshua A. Goode},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.0.9000},   url = {https://github.com/jagoode27/MethylSurroGetR}, }

title: Get Predicted Values of DNA Methylation Surrogates
text: package still development yet ready general use. Proceed caution! goal MethylSummarizR offer user-friendly tools functions generating predicted values existing DNA methylation surrogates. aims enhance accessibility reproducibility methylation data analysis.

title: Get Predicted Values of DNA Methylation Surrogates
text: can install development version MethylSurroGetR GitHub :

what: Complete Beta Matrix without Missing Values — beta_matrix_comp
title: Complete Beta Matrix without Missing Values — beta_matrix_comp
text: 15 x 5 matrix methylation beta values sampled probes without missing data. (Probes rows samples columns.)

title: Complete Beta Matrix without Missing Values — beta_matrix_comp
text: matrix 15 rows 5 columns.

title: Complete Beta Matrix without Missing Values — beta_matrix_comp
code: data(beta_matrix_comp) str(beta_matrix_comp) #>  num [1:15, 1:5] 0.103 0.288 0.435 0.985 0.9 ... #>  - attr(*, "dimnames")=List of 2 #>   ..$ : chr [1:15] "cg01" "cg02" "cg04" "cg05" ... #>   ..$ : chr [1:5] "samp1" "samp2" "samp3" "samp4" ...

what: Beta Matrix with Missing Values — beta_matrix_miss
title: Beta Matrix with Missing Values — beta_matrix_miss
text: 15 x 5 matrix methylation beta values sampled probes missing data. (Probes rows samples columns.)

title: Beta Matrix with Missing Values — beta_matrix_miss
text: matrix 15 rows 5 columns.

title: Beta Matrix with Missing Values — beta_matrix_miss
code: data(beta_matrix_miss) str(beta_matrix_miss) #>  num [1:15, 1:5] 0.103 0.288 0.435 0.985 0.9 ... #>  - attr(*, "dimnames")=List of 2 #>   ..$ : chr [1:15] "cg01" "cg02" "cg04" "cg05" ... #>   ..$ : chr [1:5] "samp1" "samp2" "samp3" "samp4" ...

what: Impute Missing Observations in methyl_surro Object — impute_obs
title: Impute Missing Observations in methyl_surro Object — impute_obs
text: function imputes missing values methylation matrix methyl_surro object using either mean median imputation. applies row-wise imputation based specified non-missing data proportion threshold.

title: Impute Missing Observations in methyl_surro Object — impute_obs
Impute Missing Observations in methyl_surro Object — impute_obs
text: methyl_surro object class methyl_surro, containing methylation matrix. method character string indicating imputation method. Must either "mean" "median". min_nonmiss_prop minimum proportion non-missing data required probe (row) imputation proceed. Must numeric value 0 1.

title: Impute Missing Observations in methyl_surro Object — impute_obs
text: methyl_surro object missing observations imputed, updating methylation matrix per given method threshold.

title: Impute Missing Observations in methyl_surro Object — impute_obs
code: # Load the sample data data(methyl_surro_miss)  # Apply mean imputation with a specified threshold for non-missing data in probes result <- impute_obs(methyl_surro_miss, "mean", min_nonmiss_prop = 0.5) #> 1 probes were not imputed because they did not meet the threshold. Please use methyl_miss() to see details.  # Check the imputed result print(result$methyl) #>          samp1     samp2     samp3     samp4      samp5 #> cg02 0.2875775        NA        NA 0.8830174         NA #> cg07 0.8998250 0.2460877 0.6070843 0.3279207 0.95450365 #> cg08 0.8895393 0.6928034 0.6405068 0.9942698 0.65570580 #> cg13 0.9630242 0.9022990 0.6907053 0.7954674 0.02461368 #> cg17 0.1428000 0.4145463 0.4137243 0.3688455 0.15244475 #> cg03        NA        NA        NA        NA         NA #> cg06        NA        NA        NA        NA         NA #> cg11        NA        NA        NA        NA         NA #> cg15        NA        NA        NA        NA         NA #> cg18        NA        NA        NA        NA         NA

what: Conversion Functions for M-Values and Beta Values — methylConversion
title: Conversion Functions for M-Values and Beta Values — methylConversion
text: functions convert methylation M-values beta values vice versa.

title: Conversion Functions for M-Values and Beta Values — methylConversion
Conversion Functions for M-Values and Beta Values — methylConversion
text: methyl matrix data frame methylation values. values must numeric matrix data frame must CpG sites row names.

title: Conversion Functions for M-Values and Beta Values — methylConversion
text: convert_m_to_beta, function returns matrix data frame beta values corresponding input M-values. convert_beta_to_m, function returns matrix data frame M-values corresponding input beta values.

title: Conversion Functions for M-Values and Beta Values — methylConversion

what: Summarize Missing Data in methyl_surro Object — methyl_miss
title: Summarize Missing Data in methyl_surro Object — methyl_miss
text: function summarizes missing data methyl_surro object. identifies probes partial missing data (missing observations) probes missing samples (missing probes).

title: Summarize Missing Data in methyl_surro Object — methyl_miss
Summarize Missing Data in methyl_surro Object — methyl_miss
text: methyl_surro object class methyl_surro.

title: Summarize Missing Data in methyl_surro Object — methyl_miss
text: list two elements: missing_obs named numeric vector proportion missing observations probe value greater 0. missing_probes character vector probes missing samples

title: Summarize Missing Data in methyl_surro Object — methyl_miss
code: # Load Methylation Beta Matrix data(beta_matrix_miss, package = "MethylSurroGetR")  # Load Weights from a Named Vector data(wts_vec_lin, package = "MethylSurroGetR")  # Build the methyl_surro Object surrogate <- surro_set(methyl = beta_matrix_miss,                        weights = wts_vec_lin,                        intercept = "Intercept")  # Summarizing Missing Values missing_summary <- methyl_miss(methyl_surro = surrogate) print(missing_summary) #> $missing_obs #> cg02 cg07  #>  0.6  0.2  #>  #> $missing_probes #> [1] "cg03" "cg06" "cg11" "cg15" "cg18" #>

what: Constructed methyl_surro Object with Complete Data — methyl_surro_comp
title: Constructed methyl_surro Object with Complete Data — methyl_surro_comp
text: methyl_surro object constructed beta_matrix_comp wts_vec_lin.

title: Constructed methyl_surro Object with Complete Data — methyl_surro_comp
text: object class methyl_surro, containing following components: methyl matrix methylation data CpG sites row names. values missing, simulating incomplete data scenarios. weights named numeric vector representing weights CpG sites, excluding intercept. intercept numeric value intercept term, NULL applicable.

title: Constructed methyl_surro Object with Complete Data — methyl_surro_comp
code: data(methyl_surro_comp) str(methyl_surro_comp) #> List of 3 #>  $ methyl   : num [1:10, 1:5] 0.288 0.9 0.89 0.963 0.143 ... #>   ..- attr(*, "dimnames")=List of 2 #>   .. ..$ : chr [1:10] "cg02" "cg07" "cg08" "cg13" ... #>   .. ..$ : chr [1:5] "samp1" "samp2" "samp3" "samp4" ... #>  $ weights  : Named num [1:10] -0.00908 -0.00116 0.00598 -0.00756 0.00122 ... #>   ..- attr(*, "names")= chr [1:10] "cg02" "cg03" "cg06" "cg07" ... #>  $ intercept: Named num 1.21 #>   ..- attr(*, "names")= chr "Intercept" #>  - attr(*, "class")= chr "methyl_surro"

title: Constructed methyl_surro Object with Missing Values — methyl_surro_miss
text: object class methyl_surro, containing following components: methyl matrix methylation data CpG sites row names. values missing, simulating incomplete data scenarios. weights named numeric vector representing weights CpG sites, excluding intercept. intercept numeric value intercept term, NULL applicable.

title: Constructed methyl_surro Object with Missing Values — methyl_surro_miss
code: data(methyl_surro_miss) str(methyl_surro_miss) #> List of 3 #>  $ methyl   : num [1:10, 1:5] 0.288 0.9 0.89 0.963 0.143 ... #>   ..- attr(*, "dimnames")=List of 2 #>   .. ..$ : chr [1:10] "cg02" "cg07" "cg08" "cg13" ... #>   .. ..$ : chr [1:5] "samp1" "samp2" "samp3" "samp4" ... #>  $ weights  : Named num [1:10] -0.00908 -0.00116 0.00598 -0.00756 0.00122 ... #>   ..- attr(*, "names")= chr [1:10] "cg02" "cg03" "cg06" "cg07" ... #>  $ intercept: Named num 1.21 #>   ..- attr(*, "names")= chr "Intercept" #>  - attr(*, "class")= chr "methyl_surro"

what: Fill Missing Probes in methyl_surro Object Using Reference Data — reference_fill
title: Fill Missing Probes in methyl_surro Object Using Reference Data — reference_fill
text: function fills missing probes methylation matrix methyl_surro object based external reference data. Users can specify imputation consider fully missing rows, partially missing rows, entire dataset.

title: Fill Missing Probes in methyl_surro Object Using Reference Data — reference_fill
code: reference_fill(   methyl_surro,   reference,   col_name = NULL,   type = c("probes", "obs", "all") )

title: Fill Missing Probes in methyl_surro Object Using Reference Data — reference_fill
text: methyl_surro object class methyl_surro, containing methylation matrix. reference named numeric vector matrix/data frame row names, containing reference values probes impute missing data. matrix data frame provided, specify column using col_name argument. col_name Optional; character string specifying column use reference matrix data frame. type character string specifying scope filling missing data: "probes": Fill missing probes. "obs": Fill missing observations "": Fill missing probes observations

title: Fill Missing Probes in methyl_surro Object Using Reference Data — reference_fill
text: methyl_surro object methylation matrix updated filling specified missing probes based reference data.

title: Fill Missing Probes in methyl_surro Object Using Reference Data — reference_fill

what: Calculate Predicted Values from methyl_surro Object — surro_calc
title: Calculate Predicted Values from methyl_surro Object — surro_calc
text: function calculates predicted values based provided methyl_surro object. probes (rows) completely missing, values set zero, count probes stored. Columns (samples) missing values removed, count also recorded. function aligns multiplies weights methylation matrix, adds intercept specified, applies specified transformation results.

title: Calculate Predicted Values from methyl_surro Object — surro_calc
Calculate Predicted Values from methyl_surro Object — surro_calc
text: methyl_surro object class methyl_surro. transform character string specifying transformation apply. can "linear", "count", "probability".

title: Calculate Predicted Values from methyl_surro Object — surro_calc
text: named vector predicted values names corresponding sample names methylation matrix.

title: Calculate Predicted Values from methyl_surro Object — surro_calc
code: # Load \code{methyl_surro} Object data(beta_matrix_comp, package = "MethylSurroGetR")  # Generating Surrogate Estimates from Linear Model Weights pred_lin <- surro_calc(methyl_surro = methyl_surro_comp,                        transform = "linear") print(pred_lin) #>    samp1    samp2    samp3    samp4    samp5  #> 1.197718 1.200473 1.206967 1.199796 1.198156

title: Create a methyl_surro Object — surro_set
text: function takes methylation matrix set weights (provided named vector, single-column data frame, single-column matrix row names) returns object class methyl_surro.

title: Create a methyl_surro Object — surro_set
text: methyl matrix methylation data. values must numeric matrix must CpG sites row names. weights named numeric vector single-column data frame matrix CpGs row names, representing weights. intercept optional name intercept term within weights. provided, specified intercept separated weights stored separately.

title: Create a methyl_surro Object — surro_set
text: object class methyl_surro containing following components: methyl input methylation matrix, filtered include probes present weights, additional empty rows added weights present methylation data. weights named numeric vector weights. intercept numeric value intercept, provided. NULL otherwise.

title: Weights Data Frame — wts_df
text: data frame containing regression weights linear, logistic, Poisson regression models 10 probes.

title: Weights Data Frame — wts_df
text: data frame 10 rows 3 columns: wt_lin Weights linear regression wt_prb Weights logistic (probability) regression wt_cnt Weights Poisson (count) regression

title: Weights Matrix — wts_mat
text: 10 x 3 matrix regression weights.

title: Weights Matrix — wts_mat
text: matrix 10 rows 3 columns. wt_lin Weights linear regression wt_prb Weights logistic (probability) regression wt_cnt Weights Poisson (count) regression

title: Poisson Regression Weights Vector — wts_vec_cnt
text: named vector weights Poisson (count) regression model.

title: Poisson Regression Weights Vector — wts_vec_cnt
text: named vector 10 elements.

text: named vector weights linear regression model.

title: Linear Regression Weights Vector — wts_vec_lin
text: named vector 10 elements.
